title: Dar, Saudi Business delegation vow to deepen economic cooperation
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 08 (APP):Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar on Wednesday received Prince Mansour bin Mohammad Al Saud, Chairman of the Saudi-Pakistan Joint Business Council (JBC), who is leading a high-level Saudi business delegation currently visiting Pakistan.
Welcoming the delegation, Senator Dar expressed satisfaction over the growing momentum in Pakistan–Saudi Arabia economic relations, emphasizing the “tremendous scope for enhanced cooperation” between the two brotherly nations, a DPM’s Office news release said.
He highlighted Pakistan’s conducive investment environment and reaffirmed the government’s full commitment to facilitating Saudi investments across diverse sectors.
Prince Mansour bin Mohammad Al Saud appreciated the progress and success of the Saudi-Pakistan Joint Business Council, describing it as one of the most effective and dynamic business councils globally.
Both sides agreed to further strengthen bilateral trade and investment linkages, underscoring their shared commitment to expanding economic collaboration for the mutual prosperity of Pakistan and Saudi Arabia.
